Profile Summary 

An enthusiastic and committed professional with ~3 years of experience years across the roles in sales – Inside Sales, Key 

Account Management, Market Research, Profiling Data, Research Analysis, Lead Generation & Conversion and Concept Selling. 

International exposure to work in a multi-cultural global environment through assignments and offsite projects from Malaysia, 

Singapore and Indonesia. I hold an MBA in Marketing and International Business from Galgotias University, Noida.

MERINO SERVICES& BUSINESS CONSULTING  (Jul 16’- Mar. 19)                                                                                3 Years

secondary research

needs

opportunities 
• Focus primarily to acquire Net New Customer and grow market share for Merino.

and profit drivers to deliver the appropriate Merino’s service value proposition/sales solution strategy. Single Point of Contact 
(SPOC) and Face of organization

growth goals 

Management Trainee(July 16-June 17)

coordination, planning and execution of campaigns along with sales 
• Proactively monitor market and industry trends and competition strategies to identify market development opportunities

• Capable on using CRM system for day to day tracking of activities and sales pipeline  
• Geographies covered are Malaysia, Singapore, Indonesia and PAN India  

Key Functions & Technology Consulting  

Concept Selling, IT Sales, ERP Sales, Solution Selling, Lead Generation, Market Research, CRM, Inside Sales  
IT Consulting -Infor Solutions–ERP Ln (FP 1-10), EAM, Syteline, ION, Mingle, SAP, Oracle E-Business Suite, IFS (Integrated 

Financial Systems) Applications (ERP, EAM, ESM)

Pipeline management, IT Sales, Inside Sales, ERP Solution/ Concept Selling, Market Research, Data Analysis/ Profiling, Lead 

Generation, Lead Qualification, BANT, Business Development, Key Account Management, Market Penetration, International 
Marketing, International Sales, ERP Sales, CRM Sales, B2B Sales, Cloud CRM 

Other Initiatives  

• Capability Building- Training Need Analysis, Execution of Training programs within Inside Sales Team   
• Designed and executed a campus activation for Management Students across campuses in India      
• Built a Communication strategy for campus audience (from ~5 campuses) via social networking websites.

Rapid Transpay Private Limited 

Department: Operations

• Monitoring, analyzing and generating customer-wise (new and old) reports.  
• Historical Data crunching of last 5 years of the organization.    
• Market Research.

evenly across a computer network so that no single device is overwhelmed. Load

Web servers in a load balancing scheme. If one server starts to get swamped, requests 
are forwarded to another server with more capacity.

· Project Undertaken in In- Industry Training:
A SUMMER TRAINING REPORT ON EMPLOYEE MOTIVATION AT UNDP
The project aimed at the study of motivation and job satisfaction level of employees at UNDP. I made a questionnaire for the study of motivation level among employees and other for Job satisfaction level. With this, was able to have a detailed idea about the employee’s overall job satisfaction with the organization. The HR department in the organization serves the following functions in the department:
· Recruitment and Selection.
· Performance Appraisal.
· Training and development.
· Promotion, Transfer, Separation.
· General administration & Welfare.
· Security
· Public Relation.
· Industrial relations
I surveyed 100 people in the organization
The research shows that most of the employees at UNDP are satisfied with their job. Basic amenities’ like water, Urinals, first aid, leave are provided by the organization and the employees are satisfied from the salary and the compensation in accident/death cases. They also have good relation with the management and no major problem of any kind exists in respect of working conditions.
· Research Project
PERCEPTION AND BEHAVIOUR TOWARDS INNOVATIVE HR PRACTICES: A STUDY OF BANK EMPLOYEES IN LUDHIANA CITY
ABSTRACT: 
In the era of globalization, the sustainability of each and every commercial organization has become a challenge and hence banking industry is also facing the same problem. This research paper is elaborated on various innovative Human Resource Practices in the banks of Ludhiana city for ideal working. This is exploratory type of research which explores about various HR Practices in general banking industries. The existing business environment requires banks as well as their HR teams to think creatively and come up with the new approaches to survive the downturn and bind the employees together. Innovative approaches would motivate the employees in different sectors especially the Indian Banking Sector to utilize their set of skills and knowledge through discretionary effort realizing Bank's business strategy. This approach to HRM is likely to contribute to improved economic performance of the banks as a whole. This paper tries to focus on whether the introduction of innovative HR practices leads to favourable or unfavourable outcomes among the employees in the Banking sector. The HR practices in banking sector of Ludhiana such as employee sourcing and human resource development initiatives are remarkably different from the manufacturing and other service sector companies. The study tries to find out the perception and behaviour of bank employees in Ludhiana towards innovative HR practices.



















Declaration: I declare that the above facts given by me are true to the best of my knowledge and belief.
